title: Sinner and Alcaraz Advance in Qatar Open Quarter-Finals
summary: In the Qatar Open, top tennis players Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz secured straight-set victories to advance to the quarter-finals. Sinner, ranked world number two, defeated Alexei Popyrin 6-3 7-5, while world number one Alcaraz beat Valentin Royer 6-2 7-5. This sets up potential paths for them to meet in the final, echoing their intense rivalry from 2025, where they contested six finals, including three Grand Slams, with Sinner winning Wimbledon and Alcaraz claiming the French and US Opens. Sinner's consistent performance is highlighted by reaching at least the quarter-finals in 28 of his last 30 tournaments, and he boasts 22 wins in his past 23 matches. Other notable results include Karen Khachanov's win over Marton Fucsovics, setting up a match with Alcaraz, and Jakub Mensik's victory against Zhang Zhizhen, leading to a quarter-final clash with Sinner. Additionally, Stefanos Tsitsipas upset Daniil Medvedev, and players like Arthur Fils and Jiri Lehecka also progressed, completing a competitive quarter-final lineup in Doha.
